column4: hi. what's the preferred way of manually stopping and starting squid on ubuntu? the init script mentioned in https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Squid doesn't exist
try « sudo service squid START|STOP|RESTART »
unrecognized service
how did you install squid?
synaptic, took the default squid package and accepted to install the dependencies
what ubuntu version?
do you have /etc/init/squid.conf?
yes, and squid itself works fine too
try "squid3" instead of "squid" in my previous command
same error
can you pastebin /etc/init/squid.conf ?
http://pastebin.com/9SWDHWGQ without the comments. it's the default squid.conf, haven't modified it at all yet
nah, I meant /etc/init/squid, but one sec while I check something
nah, I meant /etc/init/squid.conf (oops), but one sec while I check something
do you know of the "squid3" package's relationship to the "squid" package?
not really, but I reckon it's some sort of unstable version, if squid 2 is still the default squid package?
I see. I'm inclined to say that the missing file in /etc/init.d is a bug (if you see things like gdm, they have the upstart script and then a compatibility script in /etc/init.d)
yea, the others do. what are the files in /etc/init for? they're all .conf files but look more like init scripts to me
they're used by upstart (replaced sysv init)
does « start squid » work?
and « stop squid » of course too :)  I think these should work for pure upstart jobs
